questions.stem: Which combination BEST describes inputs to a group risk unit rate for GLA?
options: Age profile, sums assured, industry mix, scheme design, and (where credible) claims experience
Interest rates, FX volatility, and broker commission only
Number of HR staff, payroll software, and employee satisfaction score
The trustees’ names and the insurer’s brand awareness
questions.explanation: Pricing uses demographic risk, exposure, industry/occupation, design, and credible experience; other items listed are not core pricing drivers.

questions.stem: Below the Free Cover Limit (FCL), which statement is MOST accurate?
options: All members must provide full medicals.
Members are typically covered without individual evidence of health.
Only executives are covered.
Employees must pay the premium personally.
questions.explanation: FCL allows cover up to a per‑member threshold without medical underwriting; above it, evidence may be required.

questions.stem: Which situation MOST likely triggers facultative reinsurance on a group life case?
options: High total scheme headcount
A single member with a very large sum assured above treaty limits
A change from monthly to annual premium payments
Improved data quality from the employer
questions.explanation: Very large individual sums can exceed treaty automatic acceptance and require facultative review.

questions.stem: Which factor is LEAST likely to reduce an insurer’s quoted rate at renewal?
options: Improved scheme claims experience over several years
Cleaner, timely membership data and fewer back‑dated adjustments
A shift toward hazardous occupations
A larger scheme with more credible exposure
questions.explanation: More hazardous occupations increase expected claims and tend to worsen rates.

questions.stem: Experience rating is MOST appropriate when:
options: The scheme is small with no history
There is several years of credible claims and exposure data
Employees are mainly under age 25
The employer wants to remove all volatility
questions.explanation: Experience rating relies on credible historic data and doesn’t remove volatility entirely.

questions.stem: Which statement about actively‑at‑work (AAW) conditions is MOST accurate?
options: AAW replaces all eligibility rules.
AAW confirms members are performing normal duties on key dates; it reduces anti‑selection risk.
AAW guarantees acceptance above the FCL.
AAW is set by reinsurers only and not by insurers.
questions.explanation: AAW is a common eligibility control to ensure members are actually working when cover attaches.

questions.stem: A large scheme’s last 5 years show claims significantly below expected. Which outcome is MOST consistent with an experience‑rated renewal?
options: Improved rate relative to pooled market base, adjusted for credibility
No change because past claims never influence pricing
Guaranteed reduction regardless of current risk mix
Rates must increase because the treaty requires it
questions.explanation: Good experience usually supports sharper pricing, blended with a credibility factor to avoid over‑reacting.

questions.stem: Which admin control MOST directly prevents premium drift from unreported joiners/leavers?
options: Quarterly membership data audits and reconciliation
Annual claims satisfaction surveys
A longer rate guarantee period
Moving payroll to a new provider
questions.explanation: Regular reconciliations keep exposure aligned to the premium basis and reduce adjustments.

questions.stem: What is the usual effect of reinsurer catastrophe cover on an insurer’s portfolio?
options: Increases retained tail risk
Reduces capital strain from extreme events and supports pricing stability
Eliminates the need for underwriting
Transfers all claims handling to the reinsurer
questions.explanation: Catastrophe protection caps tail losses, supporting solvency and pricing stability; it doesn’t remove underwriting or claims handling.

questions.stem: Which SLA metric is MOST relevant to employer satisfaction for group life claims?
options: Number of site visits per year
Average claim payment turnaround once documentation is complete
Insurer social media engagement rate
Number of marketing emails sent
questions.explanation: Timely claim payment is a key outcome metric for employers and beneficiaries.

questions.stem: Why might an insurer blend pooled and experience rates using a credibility factor?
options: To ensure the final rate equals the market average
To avoid over‑reacting to short‑term volatility when the data set is only partly credible
Because reinsurers prohibit using experience at all
To comply with trust law
questions.explanation: Credibility weighting tempers randomness in limited data while recognising scheme‑specific experience.

questions.stem: Which change is MOST likely to require an insurer to obtain a GP report or medical evidence?
options: A member’s sum assured moves above the scheme’s FCL
The scheme switches payroll providers
The employer changes the rate guarantee from 2 to 3 years
The glossary definition of GLA is updated
questions.explanation: Sums above FCL usually trigger individual underwriting requirements.
